intro: Englerastrum schweinfurthii, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds make it a notable species in its ecological niche.
